fields.summary: Enable bucket tagging in the console to facilitate tracking in usage reports

status.name: In QA

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.summary: Add support for S3 Bucket tagging

comments.body: [~viglesias]/[~shaon], Bucket tagging is not being applied to the bucket. *Steps* # Using [Group #1 cloud|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/QA/Euca+4.1+Quality+Dashboard#Euca4.1QualityDashboard-TypeofDeployments], used the following IAM access policy with a non-admin user: {code} # euare-grouplistpolicies -g Testers -v --region admin-hspencer@group1 cfn-euca9886 { "Statement": [ { "Sid": "Stmt1419017169361", "Action": [ "cloudformation:CreateStack", "cloudformation:DeleteStack", "cloudformation:DescribeStackEvents", "cloudformation:DescribeStackResource", "cloudformation:DescribeStackResources", "cloudformation:DescribeStacks", "cloudformation:ListStacks", "cloudformation:ListStackResources" ], "Effect": "Allow", "Resource": "*" }, { "Sid": "Stmt1419265568046", "Action": [ "s3:CreateBucket", "s3:DeleteBucket", "s3:DeleteBucketPolicy", "s3:GetBucketAcl", "s3:GetBucketPolicy", "s3:GetLifecycleConfiguration", "s3:ListAllMyBuckets", "s3:GetBucketTagging", "s3:PutBucketTagging", "s3:ListBucket", "s3:ListBucketVersions", "s3:PutBucketAcl", "s3:PutBucketPolicy", "s3:PutLifecycleConfiguration" ], "Effect": "Allow", "Resource": "*" } ] } {code} to create a cloudformation stack using the following template: {code} # cat cfn-osg-bucket-tagging-template.json { "AWSTemplateFormatVersion" : "2010-09-09", "Description" : "Cloudformation Example => Create bucket with public-read access control list (ACL) and bucket tagging", "Resources" : { "S3Bucket" : { "Type" : "AWS::S3::Bucket", "Properties" : { "BucketName" : "buckettaggingtest", "Tags" : [ {"Key" : "Application", "Value" : "bucket-tagging-test" } ], "AccessControl" : "PublicRead" }, "DeletionPolicy" : "Retain" } }, "Outputs" : { "BucketName": { "Value": { "Ref": "S3Bucket" }, "Description": "Name of OSG Bucket Created" } } } {code} # Confirmed that the stack was created successfully, and the bucket was present: {code} # euform-describe-stacks --region tessai-group1@group1 STACK BucketTaggingV4 CREATE_COMPLETE Complete! Cloudformation Example => Create bucket with public-read access control list (ACL) and bucket tagging 2014-12-26T23:51:13.153Z OUTPUT BucketName buckettaggingtest # ./s3cmd/s3cmd --config=.s3cfg-tessai-group1 --signature-v2 ls 2014-12-26 23:51 s3://buckettaggingtest {code} # Used boto (v2.34.0) and AWS CLI (1.6.10) to confirm that that bucket tag wasn't available. #* _using boto via ipython (debug file attached)_ {code} In [6]: s3 = S3Connection(aws_access_key_id="AKISVIWPLSGR6BRPMJE0", aws_secret_access_key="MYvTWQbwDJ0nTL83gud7JePkdR2vtS03tIfhukQJ", host="objectstorage.h-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com", is_secure=False, port=8773, calling_format=OrdinaryCallingFormat()) In [7]: s3.get_all_buckets() Out[7]: [, ] In [8]: bucket = s3.get_bucket('buckettaggingtest') In [9]: bucket.get_tags() --------------------------------------------------------------------------- S3ResponseError Traceback (most recent call last) in () ----> 1 bucket.get_tags() /usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/boto/s3/bucket.pyc in get_tags(self) 1824 1825 def get_tags(self): -> 1826 response = self.get_xml_tags() 1827 tags = Tags() 1828 h = handler.XmlHandler(tags, self) /usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/boto/s3/bucket.pyc in get_xml_tags(self) 1841 else: 1842 raise self.connection.provider.storage_response_error( -> 1843 response.status, response.reason, body) 1844 1845 def set_xml_tags(self, tag_str, headers=None, query_args='tagging'): S3ResponseError: S3ResponseError: 404 Not Found NoSuchTagSetThe TagSet does not existbuckettaggingtestda5ee9fc-4b65-45c9-a62d-75da2cc19231 {code} #* _Using AWS CLI_ {code} $ aws --endpoint-url http://objectstorage.h-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api get-bucket-tagging --bucket buckettaggingtest --profile hspencer-group1 A client error (Unknown) occurred when calling the GetBucketTagging operation: Unknown $ aws --endpoint-url http://objectstorage.h-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api get-bucket-tagging --bucket buckettaggingtest --profile hspencer-group1 --debug 2014-12-26 18:06:06,991 - MainThread - awscli.clidriver - DEBUG - CLI version: aws-cli/1.6.10 Python/2.7.8 Darwin/14.0.0, botocore version: 0.80.0 2014-12-26 18:06:06,991 - MainThread - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event session-initialized: calling handler 2014-12-26 18:06:06,991 - MainThread - botocore.hooks - DEBUG - Event session-initialized: calling handler 2014-12-26 18:06:06,992 - MainThread - botocore.service - DEBUG - Creating debug log from using python boto to grab bucket tagging information.

Looks like the option to add tagging is accepted, however displaying the tags seems to not work (example using AWS CLI): {code} $ aws --endpoint-url http://objectstorage.h-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api put-bucket-tagging --bucket buckettaggingtest --tagging '{"TagSet":[{"Key":"Purpose","Value":"test-bucket-tagging"}]}' --profile tessai-group1 $ aws --endpoint-url http://objectstorage.h-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api get-bucket-tagging --bucket buckettaggingtest --profile hspencer-group1 --debug 2014-12-26 19:41:26,027 - [~hspencer], looks like this issue happened during a merge. I think, [~swathi] has already pushed a fix to testing fixing this one and few other error reporting improvements,
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/415d3669fc8afd2a337592d6377fbf47d13f5c39

Please let me know if you are still seeing this issue. Since the commit is on the same day we have deployed the cloud, if you still see the issue we might need to upgrade the packages.

*update:* updated cloud with the latest packages.
{noformat}
Name        : eucalyptus                   Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.1.0                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.22967.321.20150111git3acde28.el6   Build Date: Sun 11 Jan 2015 11:28:28 PM PST
Install Date: Mon 12 Jan 2015 03:01:54 AM PST      Build Host: ip-172-16-20-229
{noformat}

Hey [~shaon]/[~swathi], I just used the recently updated [Group #2 cloud|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/QA/Euca+4.1+Quality+Dashboard#Euca4.1QualityDashboard-Group#2], and I still see the issue regarding {{GetBucketTagging operation: Unknown}}: {code} # aws --endpoint-url http://objectstorage.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3 ls --profile tessai-group2 2015-01-14 02:01:13 ubuntu-vivid-server-20150113 # aws --endpoint-url http://objectstorage.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3 mb s3://mongodb-logs --profile tessai-group2 make_bucket: s3://mongodb-logs/ # aws --endpoint-url http://objectstorage.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3 ls --profile tessai-group2 2015-01-14 02:15:18 mongodb-logs 2015-01-14 02:01:13 ubuntu-vivid-server-20150113 # aws --endpoint-url http://objectstorage.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api put-bucket-tagging --bucket mongodb-logs --tagging '{"TagSet":[{"Key":"Purpose","Value":"mongodb-transaction-logs"}]}' --profile tessai-group2 # aws --endpoint-url http://objectstorage.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api get-bucket-tagging --bucket mongodb-logs --profile tessai-group2 A client error (Unknown) occurred when calling the GetBucketTagging operation: Unknown {code} _With debugging_ {code} # aws --endpoint-url http://objectstorage.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api get-bucket-tagging --bucket mongodb-logs --profile tessai-group2 --debug 2015-01-14 02:17:36,966 - [~swathi]/[~shaon],

Any update here?  Thanks for your help in advance.

[~hspencer], [~shaon] brought this up a little while back but I haven't had the chance to debug the issue

[~viglesias], I wanted to run this by you before I debug/fix the issue. Bucket tagging is a new feature (possibly in TP?) but the issue of not being able to retrieve tags breaks the core feature. If we find that the fix is isolated just to the bucket tagging logic and has very little regression potential, can we target it for 4.1.0?
[~swathi], yes, that looks like it. It checking the wrong List which is always empty. Thanks swathi.

[~swathi]/[~shaon]:

Solid work here.  Just verified that this issue is fixed.
